UserMonthlyMetricOwnerSharingRule.name: UserMonthlyMetricOwnerSharingRule
UserMonthlyMetricOwnerSharingRule.description: Represents the rules for sharing the user monthly metric with users other than the owner.

AccessLevel.description: Determines the level of access users have to records. Values are: Read (read only) Edit (read/write)

Description.description: Description of the sharing rule. Maximum length is 1000 characters.

DeveloperName.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance slows down while Salesforce generates one for each record.

GroupId.description: ID of the source group. Records that are owned by users in the source group trigger the rule to give access.

Name.description: Label of the sharing rule as it appears in the UI. Maximum length is 80 characters.

UserOrGroupId.description: ID of the user or group that you are granting access to.
